column4: Does anyone knows a software to see if my fingerprint reader is instaled properly?
so what do you get from "lsusb"
humm the hardware is listed on lsusb response..
ok, what line lsits your device ?
Bus 003 Device 002: ID 00ff:5731 Authentec, Inc. AES3500 Trueprint Sensor
the important information is 00ff:5731 you may want to google that along with ubuntu... the lsusb atleast tells you that your system can see the device plugged in
do you know what model it is ?
any other devices listed by lsusb that might be the one ?
The is a Elan Microeletronics Corp. I dont know what is this... Any other devices listed i know what is... sry for my bad english
don't worry about your English. Nut you will need to understand the real manufacturer of your device and then you should be able to find if there is a driver available for it

this might also help: do "sudo mount -t usbfs none /proc/bus/usb" and then "sudo cat /proc/bus/usb/devices" you should be able to find the same device id's but also now see what driver is laoded if any.
that is all I can help with at the moment. Once you know what the real manufacturer is then you will be able to see what driver you need and if it is loaded.
